definition: to blindly follow suit (idiom)/to imitate slavishly/to do what everyone else is doing
also
surname Bu
a step/a pace/walk/march/stages in a process/situation
also
to hasten/to hurry/to walk fast/to approach/to tend towards/to converge

sentences.english: And this kind of uncomfortableness associates and follows everyone of us closely.
sentences.chinese: 而且这种不适感如影随形，与我们每个人亦步亦趋。

sentences.english: In fact, Beddgelert would follow his master's every move.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，贝德格勒特对主人亦步亦趋。

sentences.english: These companies are no longer content to be mere followers.
sentences.chinese: 这些企业不再满足于亦步亦趋。

definition: see 亦步亦趨|亦步亦趋[yi4 bu4 yi4 qu1]
to follow precisely/to comply with
to lead the way
in big strides/(fig.) in giant steps
to walk slowly/to amble along/gradually/slowly
to guide/to show the way
striding forward with head high (idiom); to walk with spirited and vigorous step/to strut
to come to a stand/to stop
to follow sb closely (idiom)/to keep close to
step/pace
at a stride/taking large steps (while walking)
quick step
trembling with fear/with fear and trepidation
cowering/cringing
docile/submissive
neither too fast nor too slow (idiom)
